[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Error Handling] [VMStatus Error Injection] Can an attacker cause finish() to return specific VMStatus errors that are misinterpreted by the caller, leading to incorrect error handling? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Error Handling] [Error State Pollution] If finish_with_squashed_change_set() fails, does it leave the session in a valid error state, or can subsequent operations access corrupted session data? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Error Handling] [Change Set Validation Failure] When SystemSessionChangeSet::new() fails, is the partially constructed change set properly discarded, or can it leak into subsequent operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Error Handling] [Cascading Failures] If both the transaction and its abort hook fail, how are cascading errors handled - can this cause loss of critical error information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Error Handling] [Silent Error Suppression] Are there any code paths where errors in abort hook execution are silently caught and suppressed, allowing invalid state to persist? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Integration] [Prologue-Abort Hook State Mismatch] Can inconsistencies between prologue_session_change_set and abort hook expectations cause the spawned session to operate on stale or invalid state? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Integration] [Epilogue Interference] Since abort hooks run before epilogue, can malicious abort hook changes interfere with epilogue execution, causing fee payment failures or other issues? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Integration] [Module Storage Version Mismatch] If module_storage contains different module versions during abort hook vs. main transaction execution, can this cause bytecode incompatibilities? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Integration] [Change Set Config Inconsistency] If change_set_configs differ between when the session is created and when finish() is called, can this bypass size or validation limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Integration] [VM Version Incompatibility] Can abort hooks created under one VM version be finished under a different version, causing compatibility issues or invariant violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [DoS] [Abort Hook Spam] Can an attacker intentionally abort transactions repeatedly to spam abort hook session creation, exhausting validator memory or CPU resources? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [DoS] [Large Change Set DoS] Can an attacker create abort hooks with extremely large change sets that consume excessive memory during finish() processing? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [DoS] [Expensive Squashing Operations] Can crafted change sets with many conflicting writes cause O(nÂ²) or worse performance during squash_additional_change_set()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [DoS] [Session Accumulation] If abort hook sessions are not properly cleaned up on error, can they accumulate and cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [DoS] [Resolver Saturation] Can repeated abort hook operations saturate the resolver with queries, causing performance degradation for other transactions? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Validation] [TransactionMetadata Validation] Does new() properly validate all fields of TransactionMetadata before using them to create SessionId, or can malformed metadata cause panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Validation] [SystemSessionChangeSet Content Validation] Does SystemSessionChangeSet::new() validate the contents of the change set (resource types, sizes, permissions), or just structural properties? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Validation] [Module Storage Integrity] Is module_storage validated to ensure it contains only legitimate, verified modules before being used in finish()? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Validation] [Resolver Integrity Check] Is the resolver parameter validated to ensure it provides a consistent view before being used to spawn the session? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Validation] [Change Set Size Limits] Are there enforced limits on the size of abort hook change sets to prevent resource exhaustion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Crypto] [Session ID Hash Collision] SessionId::run_on_abort creates a hash from transaction metadata - can hash collisions cause different transactions to share abort hook sessions? (High)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Crypto] [Script Hash Manipulation] Can the script_hash in TransactionMetadata be manipulated to create collisions or bypass script-based security checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Crypto] [Signature Bypass via Abort] Can an attacker use abort hooks to execute operations that would normally require signatures without proper authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty Prologue Change Set] If prologue_session_change_set is empty, does RespawnedSession::spawn() handle this correctly, or can it cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/move_vm_ext/session/user_transaction_sessions/abort_hook.rs] [Edge Case] [Recursive Abort Hook] Can code executed in an abort hook cause another transaction to abort, creating nested or recursive abort hook executions? (Medium)
